courseDescription:
Political science is the study of politics from a scientific perspective. It is a social science that analyses political activity, political ideas, conduct and related constitutions and laws. This course delves into the ideas and practices of the study of politics. You will learn about democracy, such as its various roles and essential processes. In addition, you will be able to explore the importance of elections in politics and what constitutes a political party. We answer questions like ‘what classifies pressure groups?’ or ‘what is the democratic system in the UK?’. These questions will be addressed and answered before we move on to the European Union.

We will then explore the roles and duties of the Prime Minister and their Cabinet. Learn about the judicial system, how it works and the concepts of devolution, liberalism, conservatism and socialism in politics. Finally, we will help you investigate the theories about the influence of feminism and multiculturalism on politics. We will research the laws in place regarding the constitution and find out how the Supreme Court works. This course will also examine the executive branch, the judicial branch and the electoral process. You will be able to answer questions relating to the principles of the U.S. constitution and the role of the head of state.

This course will show you how to apply essential principles and developmental processes to politics. We present specific ideas and procedures so you can use them confidently in your political career or understanding of politics. This course is perfect for introducing you to the vocation of a political scientist. So enrol immediately and learn the fundamentals of this career.
